info.description: With the smart-me REST API you get Access to all your devices in the smart-me Cloud and you can add your own devices. So it's a easy way to add the smart-me Cloud support to your Hardware or Software Product.
info.title: smart-me

put.description: Creates a Access Token to write on a Card (e.g. NFC)
put.summary: Creates a Access Token to write on a Card (e.g. NFC)

post.description: Set an action for the specified device.
post.summary: Set an action for the specified device.

get.description: Gets all available Actions of a Device
get.summary: Gets all available Actions of a Device

get.description: Gets the additional information (e.g. Firmware Version) about a device.
get.summary: Gets the additional information (e.g. Firmware Version) about a device.

get.description: Gets all Devices
get.summary: Gets all Custom Devices

post.description:
Creates or updates a Custom Device or updates it's values.
            A Custom Device can be any device that like to add some measurement values to the smart-me Cloud.
            Only use a custom device for all non meters.
            For a new device leave the ID empty. To create a device you have to set the DeviceEnergyType.
            To update values, add the ID of the device and the values you like to set.  (See the Data Type Model for more Information)

parameters.description: Device object with all the data
parameters.name: newDevice

post.summary: Creates or updates a Custom Device or updates it's values.

get.description: Gets a Device by it's ID
get.summary: Gets a Custom Device by it's ID

get.description: Gets a Device by it's Serial Number. The Serial is the part before the "-".

parameters.description: The Serial Number of the device
parameters.name: serial

get.summary: Gets a Device by it's Serial Number. The Serial is the part before the "-".

get.description: Gets all Devices
get.summary: Gets all Devices

post.description:
Creates or updates a Device or updates it's values. 
            For a new device leave the ID empty. To create a device you have to set the DeviceEnergyType.
            To update values, add the ID of the device and the values you like to set.  (See the Data Type Model for more Information)

parameters.description: Device object with all the data
parameters.name: newDevice

post.summary: Creates or updates a Device or updates it's values.

get.description: Gets a Device by it's ID
get.summary: Gets a Device by it's ID

put.description:
Updates the On/Off Switch on a device
            For new implementations please use the "actions" command

parameters.description: The new state of the switch
parameters.name: switchState

parameters.description: The number of the switch if there are multiple (1 for L1, 3 for L3)
parameters.name: switchNumber

put.summary:
Updates the On/Off Switch on a device. 
            For new implementations please use the "actions" command

get.description: Gets all Devices for an Energy Type
get.summary: Gets all Devices for an Energy Type

get.description: Gets all Devices by it's Sub Type (e.g. E-Charging Station)
get.summary: Gets all Devices by it's Sub Type (e.g. E-Charging Station)

get.description: Gets the Values for a folder or a meter
get.summary: Gets the Values for a folder or a meter
Gets the folder menu items (each item might contain child items)

post.summary: Creates and updates the folder menu items

post.description:
M-BUS API: Adds data of a M-BUS Meter to the smart-me Cloud.
            Just send us the M-BUS Telegram (RSP_UD) and we will do the Rest.
post.summary:
M-BUS API: Adds data of a M-BUS Meter to the smart-me Cloud.
            Just send us the M-BUS Telegram (RSP_UD) and we will do the Rest.

post.description: Sets the Name of a Meter or a Folder
post.summary: Sets the Name of a Meter or a Folder

get.description: Beta: Gets the General Information for a Meter or a Folder
get.summary: Beta: Gets the General Information for a Meter or a Folder

get.description: Gets the Values for a Meter at a given Date. The first Value found before the given Date is returned.
get.summary:
Gets the Values for a Meter at a given Date. 
            The first Value found before the given Date is returned.

get.description: Gets all registrations for the Realtime API.
get.summary: Gets all registrations for the Realtime API.

post.description: Creates a new registration for the realtime API. The Realtime API sends you the data of the registred devices as soon as we have them on the cloud. More Information about the realtime API: https://www.smart-me.com/Description/api/realtimeapi.aspx
post.summary:
Creates a new registration for the realtime API. The Realtime API sends you the data of the registred devices as soon as we have them on the cloud.
             More Information about the realtime API: https://www.smart-me.com/Description/api/realtimeapi.aspx

parameters.description: The ID of the realtime API registration
parameters.name: id

post.summary: Sets the configuration of a smart-me device. The device needs to be online.

get.summary: Gets the configuration of a smart-me device.

get.description: Gets the informations for the user.
get.summary: Gets the informations for the user.
Gets all (last) values of a device

get.description: Gets the Values for a device at a given Date. The first Value found before the given Date is returned.
get.summary:
Gets all (last) values of a device
            The first Value found before the given Date is returned.

parameters.description: The date when the first value should start
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: The date when the last value should start
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: The interval in minutes betwenn the values. 0 means as fast as possible. Only 1000 values can be get in one call.
parameters.name: interval

get.summary: Gets multiple values of a device. This call needs a smart-me professional licence.

get.description: Beta: Gets all active virtual meters.
get.summary: Beta: Gets all active virtual meters

post.description: Beta: Virtual Meter API: Activates a Meter and add the Consumption to a Virtual Meter assosiated with the User.
post.summary: Beta: Virtual Meter API: Activates a Meter and add the Consumption to a Virtual Meter assosiated with the User.

post.description: Beta: Virtual Meter API: Deactivates a Virtual Meter.
post.summary: Beta: Virtual Meter API: Deactivates a Virtual Meter.

get.description: Beta: Gets all Meters available to activate as a Virtual Meter.
get.summary: Beta: Gets all Meters available to activate as a Virtual Meter.

Calculates a virtual meter from a formula. 
            A meter is coded as ID("METERID")

get.description: Gets all Virtual Tariffs of a user
get.summary: Gets all Virtual Tariffs of a user

get.description: Gets all virtual tariffs of a folder
get.summary: Gets all virtual tariffs of a folder

get.description: Gets the consumption of a folder with a virtuall tariffs.
get.summary: Gets the consumption of a folder with a virtuall tariffs.

AccessTokenToPut.description: Container Class for the Put action of an Access Token

UserId.description:
The ID of the User. The credentials provided must have permission to edit the user.
            If no ID is provided, the user in the credentials is taken.

ActionInformation.description: The Information about an Action of a device

MaxValue.description: The maximum value of this action (e.g. for an AnalogAction)

MinValue.description: The minimum value of this action (e.g. for an AnalogAction)

ObisCode.description: The Obis Code of this action. This is used as ID.

ActionToPost.description: Container Class for an action to post

Actions.description: List with all Actions for this device

ActionToPostItem.description: Container class for an action item

AdditionalMeterSerialNumber.description: An additional Meter serial number. e.g. the number of a meter a smart-me device is connected to.

FirmwareVersion.description: The Firmware Version of a Meter

HardwareVersion.description: The Hardware Version of a Meter.

AutoExportSettings.description: Settings for the auto export functionality of a meter

ExportInterval.description: The export interval of the auto export

MeterPointId.description: The meter point id set by the user

CustomDeviceToPost.description: Container Class for the Web API

ValueDate.description: The Date of the Value (in UTC). If this is null the Server Time is used.

Values.description: The Values of the custom Device

CustomDeviceValues.description: Container Class for the Custom Device Values

Device.description: Container Class for the Web API

ActivePower.description: The Actvie Power or current flow rate

ActivePowerUnit.description: The Unit of the Active Power Value

ActiveTariff.description: The Number of the Active Tariff

AdditionalMeterSerialNumber.description: An additional Meter serial number. e.g. the number of a meter a smart-me device is connected to.

CounterReading.description: The Meter Counter Reading (Total Energy used)

CounterReadingExport.description: The Meter Counter Reading only export

CounterReadingImport.description: The Meter Counter Reading only import

CounterReadingUnit.description: The Unit of the Counter Reading

DeviceEnergyType.description: The Energy Type of this device

FamilyType.description: The Family Type of the device.

MeterSubType.description: The sub meter type (e.g. warmwater or coldwater)

PowerFactorL1.description: The Power Factor (cos phi) Phase L1. Range: 0 - 1

PowerFactorL2.description: The Power Factor (cos phi) Phase L2. Range: 0 - 1

PowerFactorL3.description: The Power Factor (cos phi) Phase L3. Range: 0 - 1

SwitchOn.description: Flag if the Switch is on on this device.

SwitchPhaseL1On.description: Flag if the Phase L1 is on on this device.

SwitchPhaseL2On.description: Flag if the Phase L2 is on on this device.

SwitchPhaseL3On.description: Flag if the Phase L3 is on on this device.

ValueDate.description: Time of last successful connection the the smart-me Cloud.

DeviceInPast.description: Container Class for the Web API. Conatinas the MeterValues in the Past

CounterReading.description: The Meter Counter Reading (Total Energy used)

CounterReadingExportT1.description: The Meter Counter Reading Export Tariff 1

CounterReadingExportT2.description: The Meter Counter Reading Export Tariff 2

CounterReadingExportT3.description: The Meter Counter Reading Export Tariff 3

CounterReadingExportT4.description: The Meter Counter Reading Export Tariff 4

CounterReadingImportT1.description: The Meter Counter Reading Import Tariff 1

CounterReadingImportT2.description: The Meter Counter Reading Import Tariff 2

CounterReadingImportT3.description: The Meter Counter Reading Import Tariff 3

CounterReadingImportT4.description: The Meter Counter Reading Import Tariff 4

CounterReadingUnit.description: The Unit of the Counter Reading

DeviceToPost.description: Container Class for the Web API

ActivePower.description: The Active Power or current flow rate. In kW or m3/h

CounterReading.description: The Meter Counter Reading (Total Energy used) in kWh or m3.

CounterReadingExport.description: The Meter Counter Reading only export

CounterReadingExportT1.description: The Meter Counter Reading only export (Tariff 1)

CounterReadingExportT2.description: The Meter Counter Reading only export (Tariff 2)

CounterReadingT1.description: The Meter Counter Reading Tariff 1 in kWh or m3.

CounterReadingT2.description: The Meter Counter Reading Tariff 2 in kWh or m3.

DeviceEnergyType.description: The Energy Type of this device

MeterSubType.description: The Sub Type of this Meter.

PowerFactorL1.description: The Power Factor (cos phi) Phase L1. Range: 0 - 1

PowerFactorL2.description: The Power Factor (cos phi) Phase L2. Range: 0 - 1

PowerFactorL3.description: The Power Factor (cos phi) Phase L3. Range: 0 - 1

ValueDate.description: The Date of the Value (in UTC). If this is null the Server Time is used.

FolderData.description: Container class for the folder API

FolderMenuConfiguration.description: Container Class for the Web API representing a folder menu and it's items

TimeZoneName.description: The time zone name (usually taken from the browser)

AutoExportSettings.description: Optional auto export settings for meters.

Children.description: Children folder menu items (sub folder menu items)

FolderType.description: The folder type of the item

Id.description: The id of the folder menu item

MeterSerialNumber.description:
The serial number if the folder menu item is a meter. 
            Serial number is handled as a string, as javascript on client side cannot handle long integers properly.

InputConfigurationContainer.description: Configuration for the input of a meter (digital inputs)

Number.description: The number of the Input. (1 for Input 1)

OffText.description: The visualization text for an OFF action

OnText.description: The visualization text for an ON action

InputInformation.description: Informations about the Inputs of a Meter or Folder

Number.description: The Number of this Input. Use this as ID to switch it on or off.

Date.description: The Date of the M-BUS Telegram Readout (in UTC). If this is null the Server Time is used.

MeterFolderInformation.description: Container Class for the Web API

FirmwareVersion.description: The Firmware Version of a Meter

HardwareVersion.description: The Hardware Version of a Meter.

IsFolder.description: Flag if it's a Folder or a Meter

Name.description: Name of the Meter or Folder

MeterFolderInformationToPost.description: Container for a Meter or Folder Information to Post

Id.description: The ID of the device or folder

Name.description: Name of the Meter or Folder

OutputConfigurationContainer.description: Configuration for the outputs of a meter (analog/digital outputs)

DigitalOutputNoConnectionAction.description: The Action when the device has lost the connection

Number.description: The number of the Output. (1 for Output 1, 2 for Output 2)

OutputInformation.description: Informations about the Outputs of a Meter or Folder

Number.description: The Number of this Output. Use this as ID to switch it on or off.

ObisCode.description: The Obis Code for this Output

RegisterRealtimeApiData.description: Container class for the register realtime API API

ApiUrl.description: The URL of your endpoint. To this endpoint all the values are send to.

BasicAuthPassword.description: The Password (basic auth) of your endpoint. Leave empty of none.

BasicAuthUsername.description: The Username (basic auth) of your endpoint. Leave empty of none.

MeterId.description: The ID of the Meter. Just used if the RegistrationType is "SingleMeterRegistration".

RegistrationType.description: The Type of this registration (per meter, per user, ...)

SmartMeDeviceConfigurationContainer.description: API Container class for the meter configuration

DeviceEncryptionKey.description: The encryption key used to decrypt messages received from an external meter (used only for the smart-me modules)

DevicePinCode.description: PIN code to enter on a external meter (e.g. for the FNN meters)

DnsUpdateState.description: Configuration of the dynamic DNS service. More information: http://wiki.smart-me.com/index.php/Dynamisches_DNS

EnableModbusTcp.description: Enables or disables Modbus TCP (if the meter supports it).

InputConfiguration.description: The configuration for the intput outputs

OutputConfiguration.description: The configuration for the external outputs

ShowReactiveEnergy.description: Shows the reactive energy values (if the meter supports it).

SwitchConfiguration.description: The configuration for the phase switches

UploadInterval.description: Number of seconds the device will upload the data. For smaller values maybe a professional license is needed.

SwitchConfigurationContainer.description: The configuration for a phase switch

CanSwitchOff.description: Flag if the switch can be turned off or is always on.

Number.description: The number of the phase. (e.g. 1 for Phase L1)

User.description: Container Class for the Web API

ChildUsers.description: The Users created by this users.

Email.description: The EMail Address of the User

IdAsString.description: The ID of the user as string

IsAdmin.description: Flag if this User is an Admin User

SerialNumber.description: The Serialnumber of the Meter to activate.

ID.description: The ID of the Virtual meter to deactivate

Obis.description:
The Obis code of this value. 
            A description you can find here:
            http://wiki.smart-me.com/index.php/Obis_codes

ValuesData.description: API Container for a Meter Value

VirtualTariff.description: Container class for the virtual tariffs

Factor.description: Says how many of the active power is used in this tariff. This is calculated from the last meter values.

Id.description: The ID of the virtual tariff

Value.description: The Counter Value of this tariff

VirtualTariffConsumptionData.description: Container class for the virtual tariff consumption

Consumption.description: The consumption (e.g. kWh) of this tariff

Name.description: The Name of this virtual tariff

Price.description: The price of the energy in this timerange

TariffType.description: The type of the virtual tariff (e.g. solar)

VirtualTariffsOfFolder.description: Container class for a Virtual Tariff

Date.description: The DateTime (UTC) of this virtual tarfifs

VirtualTariffs.description: The Name of the Virtual Tariff
